instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.S5_PWRGD: What is S5_PWRGD? The S5_PWRGD signal is a status signal that indicates the S5 rails are on and functioning properly. If this is not present, check the S5 rails to see if they are functioning, and the chip that creates S5_PWRGD..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board . some time turns , some time dont
threads.message:
got this board some time turns on some time , dont ... no water damage or physical damage at all. clean board..

its turns on most of the time when its out of mac.. when i put it in most of the time it does not want to turn on .


when it turns on battery charger everything is ok....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board . some time turns , some time dont
threads.message: Remove JTAG and check for corrosion around smc reset circuitry.

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board . some time turns , some time dont
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board . some time turns , some time dont
threads.message: Need info. Voltages when it doesn't turn on etc. I bet this was dropped or flexed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board . some time turns , some time dont
threads.message:
when does not turn on , here is the voltage 


<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>=0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG_R</SIGNAL>=3.3v

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>= 3.4v

<SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL>=3.4v

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>=0v

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>=0v  ( no s4 , so there should not be s3 any way )

pls tell me which other voltage should you need ..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board . some time turns , some time dont
threads.message: Could be anything. If this was no liquid and 100% sure about that. Only thing to check is voltages on <CAPACITOR>C1300</CAPACITOR> and 1303.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board . some time turns , some time dont
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board . some time turns , some time dont
threads.message: I bet some liquid got in the trackpad which you can't see which is causing the trackpad to reset the SMC and keep it from turning on. Unplug the trackpad cable and see if you ever have the issue of it not turning on when this is unplugged. You would be turning it on now by plugging in the charger.
